info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 06 at 1:35PM PST until November 08 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST MONDAY ABOVE 3000 FEET... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 4 PM PST MONDAY ABOVE 3000 FEET FOR WESTERN SISKIYOU COUNTY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM MONDAY TO 10 PM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET FOR SOUTHERN SISKIYOU COUNTY... * WHAT...For the first Winter Storm Warning above 3000 feet, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches, except 8 to 16 inches for some of the higher terrain. South to southwest winds gusting as high as 40 mph. Snow becomes more moderate in western Siskiyou County with additional accumulations of 2 to 4 inches with amounts of 3 to 6 inches in the higher terrain. Then, the snow focuses in southern Siskiyou County. For the Winter Storm warning above 2000 feet in southern Siskiyou County, terrain enhanced heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. * WHERE...Western Siskiyou County and Central Siskiyou County. For the first Winter Storm Warning this includes portions of Sawyers Bar road near Mt. Etna and north of the Forks of Salmon; Highway 96 and between the Seiad Valley and Happy Camp; and Highway 3 east of Fort Jones. The Winter Weather Advisory will continue for portions of Western Siskiyou County including for portions of Highway 96 and Sawyers Bar Road. The second Winter Storm Warning is only for the southern portion of the area, including Highway 3 and Callahan. * WHEN...For the first Winter Storm Warning, until 4 AM PST Monday. For the second Winter Storm Warning, from 1 PM Monday to 10 PM PST Tuesday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 4 AM to 4 PM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates will be most intense during late this afternoon through this evening. This system is moving from northwest to southeast, which is why the timing of the Winter Weather Headlines overlap. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
